item.title: Isabela add a quote by Michelle Tea
item.description: "Maybe if everyone walked around being in touch with each other's hidden pain it could work out and even be beautiful, but it doesn't feel safe to be the only compassionate person on the planet." -- Michelle Tea

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Michelle Tea
item.description: "How do you make a girl know she's beautiful? What is the system for that, what do you show her, how do you give her a new set of eyes and turn her face back to the mirror?" -- Michelle Tea

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Michelle Tea
item.description: "and give me insults, give me economic discrimination, give me the darkened parking lot of a windowless queer bar, give me fleets of bigots and books banned in libraries across america, feed the world with lies about my life and plop a second helping of oppression on my plate and thank you for not making me straight." -- Michelle Tea

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "You see, freedom has a way of destroying things." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Terri Windling
item.description: "Fairy tales were not my escape from reality as a child; rather, they were my reality -- for mine was a world in which good and evil were not abstract concepts, and like fairy-tale heroines, no magic would save me unless I had the wit and heart and courage to use it widely." -- Terri Windling

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and theyâ€™ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You can love someone so much...But you can never love people as much as you can miss them." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was a hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Thomas Edison's last words were 'It's very beautiful over there'. I don't know where there is, but I believe it's somewhere, and I hope it's beautiful." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by John Green
Isabela add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps." -- John Green

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The only way you can write the truth is to assume that what you set down will never be read. Not by any other person, and not even by yourself at some later date. Otherwise you begin excusing yourself. You must see the writing as emerging like a long scroll of ink from the index finger of your right hand; you must see your left hand erasing it." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Five Great Charters knit the land Together linked, hand in hand One in the people who wear the crown Two in the folk who keep the Dead down Three and Five became stone and mortar Four sees all in frozen water." -- Garth Nix

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Kenji Yoshino
item.description: "No one has written adequately of what happens when enough of the body's naked surface is pressed against another human being's. It is a slow dismantling of ego, a suspension of the instinct to distinguish Me from Not Me." -- Kenji Yoshino

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair. Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps.
I hunger for your sleek laugh, your hands the color of a savage harvest, hunger for the pale stones of your fingernails, I want to eat your skin like a whole almond.
I want to eat the sunbeam flaring in your lovely body, the sovereign nose of your arrogant face, I want to eat the fleeting shade of your lashes,
and I pace around hungry, sniffing the twilight, hunting for you, for your hot heart, Like a puma in the barrens of Quitratue." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Does the walker choose the path, or the path the walker?" -- Garth Nix

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances." -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Isabela add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "At night I dream that you and I are two plants that grew together, roots entwined, and that you know the earth and the rain like my mouth, since we are made of earth and rain." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Isabela add a quote by Jacqueline Carey
item.description: "That which yields is not always weak." -- Jacqueline Carey
